attributes.comment:
I am writing in opposition to the proposed fee increses. Specifically, I am opposed
to all fee increses which increase the cost of international adoption. My wife and I
completed our I-600A in December of 2005 and are currently beginning the
process again due to the lengthy process in China as well as unlrealistic
expiration dates on the part of the US government.

This increase unfairly targets families who are already bearing an expensive
burnden and will discourage further adoptions. At a time of automation,
computerization and communication, it is hard to believe the costs of tracking
information in databases and filing paperwork is getting more expensive. This
becomes nothing more than a tax on those attempting to complete their families.

It is fine for those receiving services to bear the burden of supporting the service,
however, this fee increase is neither warrented nor should be placed upon those
already burdened with many other expenses. 66% increase in governement fees
for adoption is unjust and should not be approved.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Charles Hagele
